action.action-desc: Mr. Jody B. Hice of Georgia introduced the following bill; which was referred to the Committee on Oversight and Government Reform

form.official-title: To amend title 5, United States Code, to limit the use of official time for political activity and to exclude certain official time from eligibility as creditable service under CSRS and FERS, and for other purposes.

section.text: This Act may be cited as the Official Time Reform Act of 2017.

section.header: Limitation on use of official time for political activity

subsection.text: Section 7131 of title 5, United States Code, is amended—

paragraph.text: in subsection (d) by inserting and subsection (e) after preceding subsections; and
by adding at the end the following:

subsection.text: An employee may not be granted official time under this section for any time such employee would otherwise be in a duty status for purposes of engaging in any political activity, including lobbying activity.
The amendment made by this section shall apply on the date of enactment of this Act, regardless of whether an employee is covered by a collective bargaining agreement in effect on such date.

section.header: Exclusion of certain durations of official time from creditable service

subsection.text: Section 8332 of title 5, United States Code, is amended by adding at the end the following:

paragraph.text: An employee may not be allowed credit under this section for any day of service spent principally on official time, as described under subsection (b), that is in excess of 365 days in the aggregate.

For purposes of this subsection, an employee spends a day principally on official time if at least 80 percent of the time such employee would otherwise be in a duty status during such day is spent on official time granted under section 7131.

Notwithstanding paragraph (1), any service described under paragraph (1) for which an employee is not allowed credit under this subsection shall be treated as creditable service for purposes of calculating the average pay of the employee under section 8331(4).

subsection.text: Section 8411 of title 5, United States Code, is amended by—

paragraph.text: striking (i)(1) Upon application and inserting (j)(1) Upon application; and
by adding at the end the following:
An employee may not be allowed credit under this section for any day of service spent principally on official time, as described under subsection (b), that is in excess of 365 days in the aggregate.

For purposes of this subsection, an employee spends a day principally on official time if at least 80 percent of the time such employee would otherwise be in a duty status during such day is spent on official time granted under section 7131.

Notwithstanding paragraph (1), any service described under paragraph (1) for which an employee is not allowed credit under this subsection shall be considered service for purposes of calculating the average pay of the employee under section 8401(3).

subsection.text: The amendments made by this section shall apply to any applicable annuity calculated on or after October 1, 2017.
